abstract.p: Phill Golden letter deplores growing use of Webcams that show store merchandise and shoppers (July 6 article)

block.p: ''Voyeur-Cams Come to Home Furnishings'' (July 6), about Webcams that show store merchandise and shoppers, is another case of less privacy in more places. Of course, in a store you are fair game to any hidden camera or observation. As director of sales and marketing for Inforad software, I struggle with how much privacy a buyer can expect, balancing that against the need to provide service, like upgrade notices. I think that privacy and respect will become part of the long-term relationship we have with stores and other resellers. Thanks for pointing out a new wrinkle.
